page.title: 03MINING-PRESENT CROSSGATES 1
page.content: The open-cast mine complex was opened in 1982. It covers an area of about 175 hectares, although not all of it is worked at the one time. The area has a planned sequence of exploitation with mined sectors being landscaped through a five year rehabilitation scheme before handing it back to the owner. Forty men are employed on-site, and they control the machinery (draglines, tractor-shovels etc.) which provides the Longannet power station with 13000 tonnes of coal a week. Before any coal could be excavated, topsoil, overburden, and sandstone (over 100 feet of it) had to be removed and stored in neat piles called BINGS. These bings shelter the nearby villages from noise and other disturbances.
